alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:03AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg County through 1230 AM EDT... At 1203 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boydton, or 11 miles southwest of South Hill, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... La Crosse around 1225 AM EDT. South Hill and Brodnax around 1230 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Baskerville, Forksville and John H Kerr Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for south central Virginia.
